title: The South China Sea Dispute: Navigating Tensions
description: The South China Sea is a flashpoint of international tensions, involving countries like China, Vietnam, the Philippines, Malaysia, and Brunei. This debate explores territorial claims, military presence, and the impact on global trade routes.

title: Nuclear Proliferation: A Growing Threat?
description: As countries like North Korea and Iran pursue nuclear capabilities, the global community faces a dangerous challenge. How should the world respond to prevent nuclear conflict? This debate involves nations from the US, Russia, North Korea, and Iran.

title: The Amazon Rainforest: A Global Responsibility
description: The Amazon rainforest, known as the lungs of the Earth, is under threat due to deforestation, primarily in Brazil. How can international efforts help preserve this critical resource? This debate involves Brazil and global environmental partners.

title: Climate Action: Leading by Example or Falling Behind?
description: Climate change demands action, but not all countries are aligned. This debate examines the roles of the US, China, and the EU in leading global climate efforts, and how smaller nations are impacted by their policies.

title: Migration Crisis in Europe: Seeking Collaborative Solutions
description: Europe faces a migration crisis with refugees fleeing conflict and poverty from Africa and the Middle East. This debate involves EU nations, Turkey, and North African countries on how to manage the flow humanely and sustainably.

title: Trade Wars: The Battle of Tariffs and Trade Policies
description: Trade wars, primarily between the US and China, are reshaping global markets. This debate looks at the impacts of tariffs and protectionist policies on economies worldwide, including EU, Canada, and emerging markets.

title: Arctic Resources: A New Frontier of Competition
description: Melting ice in the Arctic is opening up new shipping routes and access to untapped resources. This debate explores the geopolitical tensions between Russia, Canada, the US, and other Arctic nations over control and exploration rights.

title: Cyber Warfare: Nations Under Attack
description: As cyberattacks become more frequent and sophisticated, nations like the US, Russia, China, and Iran are caught in a digital arms race. This debate addresses the global implications of cyber warfare and the need for international regulation.

title: The Syrian Conflict: International Involvement and Its Consequences
description: The Syrian civil war has drawn in global powers with conflicting interests, including the US, Russia, Turkey, and Iran. This debate delves into the international dynamics that have shaped the conflict and the humanitarian crisis that followed.

title: Water Scarcity: A Looming Conflict Between Nations
description: As water becomes a scarce resource, tensions are rising in regions like the Middle East and South Asia. This debate involves countries like India, Pakistan, and Egypt, discussing how to share and manage water resources equitably.

title: The Belt and Road Initiative: Cooperation or Debt Trap?
description: China's Belt and Road Initiative aims to connect the world through infrastructure, but many countries fear falling into debt traps. This debate explores the geopolitical and economic implications for countries in Asia, Africa, and Europe.

title: The Crisis in Venezuela: Regional and International Impact
description: The economic and political crisis in Venezuela has led to mass migration and regional instability. This debate involves Latin American countries and global powers on how to address the humanitarian and political challenges.

title: The Global Drug Trade: Fighting Cartels Across Borders
description: The international drug trade involves powerful cartels and affects nations worldwide, from Colombia to Mexico to the United States. This debate explores international strategies to combat drug trafficking and its societal impact.
